parameters.name: configtype
parameters.description: currently accepted values are istio or f5

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description:
A unique identifier for the k8s cluster or VM cluster
Typically we have multiple k8s clusters and one big giant VM cluster
in a DC.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Short name of the endpoint, e.g. "1.2.3.4". TODO: other name reqs/restrictions

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Immutable, name of the load balancer being updated. e.g. "zone-3-ingress"

parameters.name: registrytype
parameters.description: currently accepted values are kubernetes or f5

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the k8s/f5 cluster

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
TODO: down the line we'll need to gather initial info here. Till then, these will
be created by hand.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: this would be `bob`; the returned user resource would have name=`tenant/123/user/bob`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: this would be `bob`; the returned user resource would have name=`tenant/123/user/bob`

service.title: empty if this is applicable to entire workspace

workspace.title: empty if this is applicable to entire tenant

tcpConnectTimeout.description:
These two settings will go to dest rule
TCP connection timeout.

tcpKeepalive.description: If set then set SO_KEEPALIVE on the socket to enable TCP Keepalives.

circuitBreakerSensitivity.description:
the sensitivity levels will translate to specific values of
dest rule outlier detection.

payload.description:
For istio, this is a huge YAML dump of all Istio artifacts like
virtual services, destination rules, service entries, gateways,
etc. in YAML form. For F5, its all f5 config artifacts.

allowOrigin.description:
The list of origins that are allowed to perform CORS requests. The
content will be serialized into the Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header. Wildcard * will allow all origins.

allowMethods.description:
List of HTTP methods allowed to access the resource. The content will
be serialized into the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header.

allowHeaders.description:
List of HTTP headers that can be used when requesting the
resource. Serialized to Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

exposeHeaders.description:
A white list of HTTP headers that the browsers are allowed to
access. Serialized into Access-Control-Expose-Headers header.

maxAge.description:
Specifies how long the results of a preflight request can be
cached. Translates to the `Access-Control-Max-Age` header.

allowCredentials.description:
Indicates whether the caller is allowed to send the actual request
(not the preflight) using credentials. Translates to
`Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` header.

name.title: Short name of the endpoint, e.g. "1.2.3.4". TODO: other name reqs/restrictions

address.description:
REQUIRED: Address associated with the network endpoint without
the port.  Domain names can be used and must be fully-qualified
without wildcards.

ports.description:
Set of ports associated with the endpoint. The ports must be
associated with a port name that was declared as part of the
service.

labels.description: One or more labels associated with the endpoint.

locality.description:
The locality associated with the endpoint, in the form
country/region/zone. A locality corresponds to a failure domain
(country/region/zone).

weight.description:
The load balancing weight associated with the endpoint. Endpoints
with higher weights in a pool will receive proportionally higher
traffic.

managementIp.title:
If its a hardware load balancer like F5, we need its management
IP to talk to it. TODO(@rshriram): we need some credentials, or
what not to talk to F5. Those should be part of this call?

serviceName.description:
The name of the service that implements this load balancer behavior (i.e. the set of Envoys)
e.g. tenant/123/workspace/456/service/ingress-envoys.foo.com.

name.description:
TODO: down the line we'll need to gather initial info here. Till then, these will
be created by hand.

name.title: this would be `bob`; the returned user resource would have name=`tenant/123/user/bob`

dependencies.description:
The services (or namespaces) that this endpoints in this
workspace depend upon for proper operation. Must be of the form
`tenant/123/workspace/456/service/foo.com`, or
`tenant/123/workspace/456` . If omitted, its assumed that
endpoints in this workspace depend only on other services in the
same workspace as the endpoint.

service.title: empty if not associated with a service

address.description:
REQUIRED: Address associated with the network endpoint without
the port.  Domain names can be used and must be fully-qualified
without wildcards.

ports.description:
Set of inbound traffic ports associated with the endpoint. The
ports must be associated with a port number that was declared
as part of the service.

labels.description: One or more labels associated with the endpoint.

locality.description:
The locality associated with the endpoint, in the form
country/region/zone. A locality corresponds to a failure domain
(country/region/zone).

weight.description:
The load balancing weight associated with the endpoint. Endpoints
with higher weights in a pool will receive proportionally higher
traffic.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.Endpoint.description:
Endpoint defines a network address (IP or hostname) associated with
the service.

attempts.description:
REQUIRED. Number of retries for a given request. The interval
between retries will be determined automatically (25ms+). Actual
number of retries attempted depends on the httpReqTimeout.

perTryTimeout.description: Timeout per retry attempt for a given request. format: 1h/1m/1s/1ms. MUST BE >=1ms.

retryOn.description:
Specifies the conditions under which retry takes place.
One or more policies can be specified using a ‘,’ delimited list.
See the [supported
policies](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/http_filters/router_filter#x-envoy-retry-on)
and
[here](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/http_filters/router_filter#x-envoy-retry-grpc-on)
for more details.

headers.description:
The header keys must be lowercase and use hyphen as the separator,
e.g. _x-request-id_.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.HttpMatchConditi.title: A single match clause to match all aspects of a request

headerName.title: used only if what is a Header

value.title:
string to use as replacement for url rewrite/host rewrite or setting headers
no value is necessary when deleting the header

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.HttpModifyAction.title: A single modification for a part of a request

- SET: this is the only value allowed for uri and authority rewrite
 - APPEND: append and delete are applicable only for headers

modifyActions.title:
one or more mutations to be performed before forwarding.
Includes typical modifications to be done on a single request
like URL rewrite, host rewrite, headers to add/remove/append

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.HttpSettings.description: HTTP settings for a service. Applicable to ports receiving HTTP traffic.

path.description: Path to set for the cookie.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.HttpSettings.HTT.description:
Describes a HTTP cookie that will be used for sticky sessions. If
the cookie is not present, it will be generated.

header.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP header.

useSourceIp.description: Hash based on the source IP address.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.HttpSettings.Sti.title:
If set, the load balancer will route all requests from a
particular client to the same backend of the service.
TODO (@lizan): this is incomplete in envoy. It still uses ketama hash
which changes the mapping when more endpoints are added to LB pool

name.title: The name of the service that implements this load balancer

managementIp.title:
If its a hardware load balancer like F5, we need its management
IP to talk to it. TODO(@rshriram): we need some credentials, or
what not to talk to F5. Those should be part of this call?

serviceName.description:
The name of the service that implements this load balancer behavior (i.e. the set of Envoys)
e.g. tenant/123/workspace/456/service/ingress-envoys.foo.com.

services.title:
List of services attached to this loadbalancer in the form
`tenant/123/workspace/456/service/foo.com`

number.description: REQUIRED: A valid non-negative integer port number.

protocol.description:
The protocol exposed on the port.
MUST BE one of HTTP|GRPC|HTTP2|TCP|TLS.
TLS implies the connection will be routed based on the SNI header to
the destination without terminating the TLS connection.

endpointPort.description:
The endpoint port to which this service port maps to. For example, service port 80
exposed on the load balancer could map to an endpoint port 9080 on a VM.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.Port.description: Port describes the properties of a specific port of a service on a VM or k8s.

uri.description:
On a redirect, overwrite the Path portion of the URL with this
value.

authority.description:
On a redirect, overwrite the Authority/Host portion of the URL with
this value.

registrytype.title: currently accepted values are kubernetes or f5

cluster.title: A unique identifier for the k8s/f5 cluster

payload.title:
A huge json dump of all services, endpoints.
For k8s, its literally kubectl get services --all-namespaces -o json
and kubectl get po --all-namespaces -o json

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.RegistryData.description:
Please do not over engineer this anything beyond a glorified
file copy.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.Route.title: One or more destinations for the given request

weight.title: 100 if omitted. sum of all weights should add up to 100

svc.description:
Must be of form tenant/123/workspace/456/service/blah.com. If specified, incoming traffic
for the service will be forwarded to the service
specified. Typically used on ingress gateways on kubernetes
clusters.

labels.description: User identifiable tags associated with this service.

httpSettings.description:
HTTP specific settings, transformations and routing rules
associated with HTTP traffic to this service.

tcpSettings.description:
TCP specific settings, transformations and routing rules
associated with non-HTTP traffic to this service.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.Service.description:
This is roughly equivalent to Istio service entry + virtual service + destination rule
or the equivalent of Istio gateway's server [without TLS] + virtual service + dest rule
TLS is omitted from here because usually, the secOps team in the enterprise determines the
certs, the mount points, etc. The service owner should not care about it.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.StringMatch.description:
Describes how to match a given string in HTTP headers. Match is
case-sensitive.

labels.description:
Labels apply a filter over the endpoints of a service in the
service registry.

route.description: The destination to which the connection should be forwarded to.

tetrate.api.tcc.core.v1.TcpSettings.description: TCP settings for a service. Applicable to ports receiving non-HTTP traffic.

tcpConnectTimeout.description:
These two settings will go to dest rule
TCP connection timeout.

tcpKeepalive.description: If set then set SO_KEEPALIVE on the socket to enable TCP Keepalives.

circuitBreakerSensitivity.description:
the sensitivity levels will translate to specific values of
dest rule outlier detection.

address.description:
REQUIRED: Address associated with the network endpoint without
the port.  Domain names can be used and must be fully-qualified
without wildcards.

ports.description:
Set of ports associated with the endpoint. The ports must be
associated with a port name that was declared as part of the
service.

labels.description: One or more labels associated with the endpoint.

locality.description:
The locality associated with the endpoint, in the form
country/region/zone. A locality corresponds to a failure domain
(country/region/zone).

weight.description:
The load balancing weight associated with the endpoint. Endpoints
with higher weights in a pool will receive proportionally higher
traffic.

name.title: Immutable, name of the load balancer being updated. e.g. "zone-3-ingress"

managementIp.title:
If its a hardware load balancer like F5, we need its management
IP to talk to it. TODO(@rshriram): we need some credentials, or
what not to talk to F5. Those should be part of this call?

serviceName.description:
The name of the service that implements this load balancer behavior (i.e. the set of Envoys)
e.g. tenant/123/workspace/456/service/ingress-envoys.foo.com.

labels.description: If provided, will overwrite existing labels.

ports.title: if specified, overwrites existing port list

subsets.title: if specified, overwrites the existing list of subsets

name.title: this would be `bob`; the returned user resource would have name=`tenant/123/user/bob`

dependencies.description:
The services (or namespaces) that this endpoints in this
workspace depend upon for proper operation. Must be of the form
`tenant/123/workspace/456/service/foo.com`, or
`tenant/123/workspace/456` . If omitted, its assumed that
endpoints in this workspace depend only on other services in the
same workspace as the endpoint.

The services (or namespaces) that this endpoints in this
workspace depend upon for proper operation. Must be of the form
`tenant/123/workspace/456/service/foo.com`, or
`tenant/123/workspace/456` . If omitted, its assumed that
endpoints in this workspace depend only on other services in the
same workspace as the endpoint.
